title: Dense Hopfield Networks in the Teacher-Student Setting. (arXiv:2401.04191v1 [cond-mat.dis-nn])
abstract: Dense Hopfield networks are known for their feature to prototype transition and adversarial robustness. However, previous theoretical studies have been mostly concerned with their storage capacity. We bridge this gap by studying the phase diagram of p-body Hopfield networks in the teacher-student setting of an unsupervised learning problem, uncovering ferromagnetic phases reminiscent of the prototype and feature learning regimes. On the Nishimori line, we find the critical size of the training set necessary for efficient pattern retrieval. translated_title: 密集化霍普菲尔德网络在师生模式下的应用
translated_abstract: 密集化霍普菲尔德网络以其从特征到原型的转变和对抗性鲁棒性而闻名。然而，以往的理论研究主要关注其存储容量。我们通过研究师生模式下的p-体霍普菲尔德网络的相图，填补了这一空白，揭示了类似于原型和特征学习范围的铁磁相。在Nishimori线上，我们发现了高效模式检索所需的训练集的临界大小。有趣的是，我们发现师生模式的顺磁到铁磁转变与直接模型（即随机模式）的顺磁到自旋玻璃转变一致。在Nishimori线之外，我们研究了学习性能与推断温度和数据集噪声的关系。此外，我们还展示了在学生比教师使用较大的p值时，学生具有广泛的容忍度。
tldr: 密集化霍普菲尔德网络在师生模式下的研究揭示了铁磁相学习和原型学习的特点，同时发现在特定条件下的关键训练集大小。此外，研究还表明学生比教师具有更广泛的容忍度。
en_tdlr: The study of Dense Hopfield networks in the teacher-student setting reveals the characteristics of ferromagnetic phase learning and prototype learning, while also discovering the critical size of the training set under specific conditions. Additionally, the research shows that the student has a wider tolerance compared to the teacher.
